content.webTitle: Allianz chief seeks single watchdog for Europe

fields.headline: Allianz chief seeks single watchdog for Europe
fields.bodyText: Michael Diekmann, chief executive of insurer Allianz, yesterday called for a single European financial services authority to regulate a sector increasingly dominated by large pan-European groups. The creation of a single regulatory body similar to the US Securities and Exchange Commission is controversial as national regulators are not keen to give up power to a cross-border body. Mr Diekmann said Allianz now reported to 48 different national supervisory authorities across three financial sectors and was active in 29 European countries in insurance, banking and asset management.
